TopicTitle: Unable to switch to vessel while EVA

Articles.Content:
Hey, im not sure if its just me doing something wrong but im unable to swap my focus to my vessel whilst EVA.

I was trying to swap my crew around whilst in orbit but to do so i needed to put one out on an EVA as all pods were full.

I attempted L1 + right/left arrow but was unable to shift focus to anything other than the kerbal on EVA. (Ps4)

The only thing i can think of is that maybe because my other 2 kerbals are in an mk1 crew cabin and therefore my ship has no control while the pilot is EVA from mk1 command pod. Im able to swap between the two pods if there is space so its not an issue with the transfer.

Should i be able to at least focus on the ship even if it has no control?

Ill try putting an automated command pod on as well to see if anything changes when i get the chance.

Edited August 20, 2016 by Mobius2134

Try to take control over the empty Vessel via space center tracking building.

I you can even "fly" or terminate debris from decoupled rocket parts there.

Dont know if it will work.

On 30/08/2016 at 1:52 AM, Shadowrunner said:

Try to take control over the empty Vessel via space center tracking building.

I you can even "fly" or terminate debris from decoupled rocket parts there.

Dont know if it will work.

 

I haven't played in awhile now, but I'm pretty sure you revert to an earlier save if you try to get to the tracking building whilst EVA.

Worth a shot though. Thanks for the advice

have you tried manually switching while in map view?

(if your to close to eachother that your icon covers up the ship, use the selector at the top to have it set on seeing only pods)
